headline: Is It Time To Revisit American International Group (AIG) After Recent Share Price Weakness?
summary: If you are wondering whether American International Group is priced attractively right now, it helps to start with what the recent share performance and current valuation are telling you. The stock closed at US$72.93 recently, with returns of 0.9% over 7 days, a 15.2% decline over 30 days, a 13.5% decline year to date, and a 0.9% decline over 1 year, while the 3 year and 5 year returns sit at 23.4% and 109.0% respectively. These moves have put AIG back on the radar for investors who track...

headline: AIG and CVC form investment partnership
summary: The move involves the creation of substantial SMAs, operating under CVC’s credit investment strategies.

headline: AIG’s $3.5 Billion CVC Partnership Could Be A Game Changer For American International Group (AIG)
summary: American International Group (AIG) and CVC have formed a new partnership under which AIG may commit up to US$2.00 billion to CVC-managed credit strategies and contribute up to US$1.50 billion from its existing private equity portfolio to seed CVC’s new private equity secondaries evergreen platform. This move marks AIG’s first partnership with a European-headquartered asset manager and reshapes how the insurer manages legacy private equity exposures while broadening its access to private and...

headline: 3 S&P 500 Stocks We Find Risky
summary: The S&P 500 (^GSPC) is home to the biggest and most well-known companies in the market, making it a go-to index for investors seeking stability. But not all large-cap stocks are created equal - some are struggling with slowing growth, declining margins, or increased competition.
